items.text: back of a length on off, steered to point. They wisely decide against running
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chigumbura, no run

items.text: comes forward to defend, the inside edge rolls off near the batsman
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chigumbura, no run

items.preText:
salehin kibria: "nice one @istiak. only thing mashrafe cant do is any wrong"

- to be fair, Mortaza did look like he would go for a lot of runs. Credit to him for cleverly mixing it up and coming back strong
items.text: full on the stumps, driven straight to cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Moor, no run

items.text: top edge taken back of a length offcutter on the stumps, he went for maximum but only got a top-edge off the heave. Good catch by Mehidy at wide long-on, holding on after covering some ground to his right

dismissal.text: PJ Moor c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Mustafizur Rahman 17 (20b 2x4 0x6) SR: 85.00

items.preText: Ahasan: "Mashrafe is occasionally a wicket taking bowler in death overs. Most importantly, you cannot afford your two seamers to bowl the last 10 overs.(5 overs each, to be more specific)"
items.text: full on the stumps, driven but straight to short cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Chigumbura, no run

items.text: length ball on the stumps, turned to short midwicket
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Chigumbura, no run

items.text: angled across the batsman that time and pushed wide of offstump. He had given himself room and tried to flay it through the offside but missed
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Chigumbura, no run

items.text: leading edge falls safely tried to turn this ball to midwicket from legstump, but the leading edge flew over the head of point to fall safely

items.preText: Hammad Sami: "Bangladesh proving why they are better and most improved team since 2015 WC"
items.text: steps down the track, but is fooled by the slower ball. trickles off the pads and the keeper fields it
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Mavuta, no run

items.text: comes down again, and is struck on the pads again. Appeal and review taken by Bangladesh On first look, he seemed too far forward - but what do you know! It's three reds. However, the batsman was in fact too far down. Three metres down, and so he stays not out
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Mavuta, 1 leg bye

items.text: in the slot outside off and driven powerfully to long-off
full toss, tries to swing it to the legside, but only manages to get it down to long-on. Too high on the bat
caught on the point fence short ball outside off, he slashed it hard, but straight to the man

dismissal.text: E Chigumbura c Nazmul Islam b Mohammad Saifuddin 3 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

items.text: comes down the track and converts it to a full toss that he whips away to fine leg

items.preText: KP: "Most improved team after 2015 World Cup has to be England. They have won 9 successive bilateral series now. Bangladesh might have become better, but even now their most senior batsman Shakib makes same mistakes after so many years of experience."
items.text: pushed to cover and he sends the non-striker back. There was no run there
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Tiripano, no run

items.text: steered to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Tiripano, no run

items.text: back of a length on leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket, but didn't time it well
moved across the paddle it, but Mustafizur followed him and pushed it far outside off. So far that the batsman missed it, and the keeper did too
down the track, looks to have an almighty swing but misses it altogether
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Tiripano, no run

items.text: comes down the track again, giving himself room. Telegraphed his intent too early, and the canny Fizz pushes it across wide. Too far away from the batsman to make contact
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Tiripano, no run

items.preText:
Axl Rose: "Zimbabwe always falter in the last 10 overs whether they are batting or bowling. Sigh! "

That's one point Slash and Axl Rose would be in complete agreement on...
items.text: steps away again, but manages to slap it down to mid-off only, off the toe end of the bat
in the blockhole, defended with an angled bat. The ball rolls away towards point and they get a quick single

run out chance missed slower bouncer outside off. He had tried to step away again, but couldn't get hold of it. It went towards long-on and they tried to steal a second. The throw came in, but the bowler failed to collect with the batsman well out

scoop goes wrong he went down early but didn't get hold of the scoop. It flew off the edge towards fine leg, where Mustafizur ran and dived forward to take the catch. But there's some doubt about whether he has taken it cleanly. Replays seem to indicate the ball touching the ground. Mavuta survives. Third umpire Dharmasena is confused about what the soft signal was and keeps switching between over-turning it and upholding it. It turns out, the soft signal was out - and the decision is overturned
aims for the blockhole but doesn't quite get it. The batsman doesn't get hold of it either, only managing to get it to long-on off a big swing
